_header: I ne have joy ne pleasance nor comfort
_description: On the absence of his mistress — one stanza rhyme royal

BodRawPoe36.First Lines:
I ne haue Ioy plesaunce nor comforttIn yowr Absenss my verrey
                    hertes quene…
BodRawPoe36.Last Lines:
…so thus mak I a gladfull sory chereso noyth me þe
                    Absenss of my verrey lady dere
BodRawPoe36.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 151.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 50.
